abstracts.cdata!:
The Sichuan Urban Environment Project
            aims to provide a safe environmental setting for the
            sustainable long-term economic growth of urban areas in
            Sichuan Province, China. The project implements the first
            phase of an urban environmental services improvement program
            to recover from degradation of water and land resources,
            provide an adequate supply of safe water to its growing
            urban population and economy, and maintain water quality of
            the Yangtze River while protecting health, especially of
            lower income groups. The project consists of a comprehensive
            package of investments for five cities and comprises the
            following subcomponents: 1) water supply and wastewater
            systems development consisting of intercepting and linked
            sewers, outfalls from the sewers, secondary sewage
            construction, raw water transmission to treatment plants,
            treated water pumping stations, and distribution network
            improvements; 2) solid waste management consisting of
            funding operating equipment, and expanding and improving the
            existing landfills; 3) urban management information systems
            entailing creating new infrastructure, increasing
            operational efficiencies in existing infrastructure, and
            improving budgeting monitoring and management; 4)
            environmental protection including rehabilitating and
            improving access to cultural heritage sites, providing
            equipment for environmental monitoring, promotion, display,
            and adaptation of museums and historic sites; and 5)
            institutional strengthening and training.
